events.name: Powershell on Linux
events.description:
Paul Amazona will present session about PowerShell on Linux. More info will come shortly, this is to let you know that there will be meetup on 21st January. 


Powershell on Linux  1. Introduction 2. Interoperability with other languages/tools 3. Powershell Ecosystem (how to find/install modules) 4. Running through the Powershell Source Code  5. Demos  See you all soon.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Social Change Unconference
events.description:
Have a social impact project that you want to recruit more allies for? Working on something that you'd like more brains to contribute to? Want to share learnings from previous social impact work? Come join us at the Social Change Unconference!

This is a collaborative "conference" to encourage social changemakers to share their successes, learn from the experiences of others, and to encourage collaboration. 

In an unconference, participants propose topics which are then voted on. The topics with the most votes will be assigned rooms and participants are free to move from room to hear out the speaker on the topic proposed.

The unconference is free -- we only ask that you bring your curiosity and generosity. See you soon!
events.location: Community Lab at United World College SEA, 1 Tampines Street 73, #01-D119, Singapore 528704

events.name: Hack&Roll 2017
events.description:
**Please make sure you sign up through the website below!**

http://hacknroll.nushackers.org/

By students, for students - NUS Hackers' annual, largest student-run hackathon in Singapore will be happening on Saturday 21st of January next year.

Registration is absolutely free, and you're allowed to build ANYTHING you want. Students from all institutions (including primary, secondary, polytechnic and junior colleges) are welcome to attend! 

Sign up for entry here: http://hacknroll.nushackers.org/
events.location: Cinnamon & Tembusu Dining Hall, 26 College Avenue East, Singapore undefined

events.name: Conversations: Where It All Begins
events.description:
Conversations: Where It All Begins
Saturday 21 January I 2pm
Expression Gallery (Level 4)
Free. Register in the lobby.

As part of the Art and Science of Space season and in celebration of the 60th Anniversary of the Space Race, hear from prominent industry leaders as they share about their experiences in the aviation industry, advancements in aerospace innovation, and the future of human spaceflight beyond Earth. 

Laurence Chin, Country Manager at United Airlines, shares some of his personal experiences working for United Airlines, a pioneer passenger carrier that has been at the forefront of innovation in the aviation industry. Hear about his impressions and memories from key moments in aviation history, and his reflection on how a significant encounter with aerospace technologies changed the course of his life. 

As manned missions to Mars becomes closer to reality than ever, Robert E Gagne, Director at Boeing Defense Space & Security, brings exciting insights on pioneering next steps in space exploration. Learn about Boeing’s involvement in NASA’s Space Launch System, the most powerful rocket ever built for a new era of exploration beyond Earth's orbit into deep space, and be inspired by research projects benefiting humanity.
